result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Michael Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court reads-in and dismisses 13CM617.
Court authorizes transfer of Probation to Minnesota, but will be held until Probation Agent from St. Croix County County is able to talk to Defendant.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF9.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF9.

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-If Defendant pays restitution and costs in full prior to the 3 years probation will be terminated.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

$1855.76 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF9.
$61.54 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF9.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
$1,855.76 restitution to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1 Case #14CF9.
$61.54 restitution to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1 Case #14CF9.

$268.00 to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1 Case #14CF9.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be taken from prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision in Count 1 Case #14CF9.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Participate in any recommended programming.
-MRT.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Karl E. Anderson DF ATTY: James H Krave DF: Paul Michael Brooks appeared from jail. Case called at 10:51. ADA Anderson updates the Court and makes sentencing recommendation. Atty. Krave makes sentencing argument. DE makes statement. Court orders:
3 years 6 months total confinement
1 year 6 months initial confinement
2 years extended supervision
- DE to pay outstanding restitution.
- Costs
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Participate in any recommended programming. 
- MRT

 
Court notes 36 days credit. 
DE remanded.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  James H Krave   DF:  Paul Michael Brooks appeared. Case called at 1:50. Includes 13CM617, 14CF09. ADA Hartung updates the court.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G  to Ct 1  in 14CF09. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in  14CF09. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 13CM617 but will read in for purposes of restitution only. Sentencing arguments. DE is currently serving time in St. Cloud with an out date of June 21, 2016.De has another charge in Washington County. DE makes a statement. 
Crt orders on 14CF9: W/H  3 years probation with conditions:
- 4 months condition time concurrent
- DE to pay restitution of $1855.76
- Costs 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.


On 13CM617
- restitution of $61.54

If DE pays restitution and costs are in full prior to the 3 years probation will be terminated. 
DE remanded to MN dept. corrections. 
Court authorizes transfer to MN for probation but will be held until a probation agent from St. Croix County is able to talk with the DE.
filed by ADA Matthew Hartung. eif
Per SRN 1/22/16 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif

per Defendant's bond. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-25-2016 01:00 pm

***AMENDED***
Includes 14CF9 and 13CM617

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal-Mart.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  James H Krave   DF:  Paul Michael Brooks appeared from jail. Includes 14CF9 and 13CM617, was time set for Plea/Sent. Case called at 8:18 am. ADA Hartung states an agreement has been reached. Court places DEF on $500 cash bail, DEF to remain in St. Croix County Jail. In 14CF9, DEF waives preliminary hearing. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Hartung files information.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
